name: s3://eodata/CLMS/bio-geophysical/ice_phenology/clms_wsi_ice-cover-duration_europe_utm_20m_yearly_v1
browserSearchPath: CLMS Bio-geophysical Parameters, Water Bodies, Ice Phenology
collectionDescription: The Ice Cover Duration (ICD) product describes how long inland waters are covered by ice. For each pixel and for a given hydrological year, it provides the number of days with ice cover. The hydrological year starts on 1 September. The product is generated at the European scale with a spatial resolution of 20 m Ã— 20 m. It is based on ice cover maps derived from Sentinel-2 optical data (Water/Ice Cover WIC S2) and Sentinel-1 C-band Synthetic Aperture Radar data (Water/Ice Cover WIC S1). It is available for the period from 2016 to the present and can be downloaded in multiple projections and pixel spacings. More information here.

layers.longDescription: Number of days of ice cover on water during the hydrological year.

layers.shortDescription: Quality layer for the ice cover duration (ICD) layer
layers.longDescription: Quality layer providing a basic assessment of the ice cover duration layer.

layers.shortDescription: Number of days with Sentinel-1 based observations during the hydrological year
layers.longDescription: Number of days with Sentinel-1 based observations used in the interpolation of the ice cover time series within the hydrological year.

layers.shortDescription: Number of days with Sentinel-2 based observations during the hydrological year
layers.longDescription: Number of days with Sentinel-2 based observations used in the interpolation of the ice cover time series within the hydrological year.
